    		Mental Health at Chico State
    	Crisis Support
                        Counseling Center Virtual Services
                    During Fall 2022, the WellCat Counseling Center will be providing services to new and returning students.  We offer individual and group counseling via Zoom and phone for tele-mental health assistance to any Chico State student.If you need a safe confidential space to meet with your counselor, the WCCC has 2 rooms available.  Call the WellCat Counseling center at 530-898-6345 to reserve your space today.If you are in crisis and need to speak to a counselor immediately please call 530-898-6345 and follow the phone prompts (press 2) and you will be connected to a crisis counselor at that time.  We have a crisis counselor available to you 24/7 for crisis services. If you would like to schedule a new or returning appointment, or are interested in group therapy please call 530-898-6345 and leave a message if we are not available to take your call.  Please leave your name, phone number, and student ID number and one of our team members at WCCC will return your call. Wishing you all a safe and happy Spring 2021 semester!Fall 2022 GroupsOnline Care and Self-Help Options:Self Care and Wellness Podcasts(opens in new window)Online Yoga(opens in new window)Self-Compassion Meditations(opens in new window)Mindfulness Meditations(opens in new window)Behavioral Health During a Pandemic:Psychological Implications of Social Distancing(opens in new window)Resources from the APA to Help Manage Anxiety and Change due to Coronavirus(opens in new window)Coronavirus and Mental Well-being(opens in new window)Coping with Stress During Infectious Disease Outbreaks(opens in new window)Taking Care of your Behavioral Health(opens in new window)Active Minds Resources(opens in new window)
                        How to Help a Friend
                    
                        How to Help a Student
                    UMatterAs the outreach arm of the counseling center, UMatter is a program designed to eliminate negative stigmas and to promote healthy student interaction and positive mental health practices.Podcast: Chatter with UMatter(opens in new window)Join Bri and UMatter interns for relatable conversations concerning mental health.Connect on Instagram@umatterchicostate(opens in new window)@wellcat_peercoaching@wellcatcounseling(opens in new window)Peer CoachingPeer Coaching aims to provide a safe place for students to speak freely and objectively, assess barriers to academic success, and access tools and support for sustaining greater work/life balance, mental and physical health, and other benefits. Amongst life skills, students will have support with finding life purpose, meaning, and identity. Our Peer Coaches help students create achievable goals, offering encouragement, accountability, evaluating progress, and celebrating wins. Peer Coach Request Form Complete this form and a Peer Coach will reach out to you soon.WellCat ServicesWellCat Services, formerly Student Health Services, is here to ensure all students have the tools and resources for a healthy, safe, and successful experience at Chico State. 
We acknowledge and are mindful that Chico State stands on lands that were originally occupied by the first people of this area, Mechoopda, and we recognize their distinctive spiritual relationship with this land, the flora, the fauna, and the waters that run through campus. We are humbled that our campus resides upon sacred lands that since time immemorial have sustained the Mechoopda people and continue to do so today.Contact UsNeed Help?FacebookFacebookTwitterTwitterInstagramInstagramReport an accessibility issueReport a broken link on this pageTitle IXPrivacy PolicyCalifornia State University, Chico400 West First StreetChico, CA 95929Copyright © 2023 All Rights Reserved
